header.label: Effects on the Average Drinker*
header.note: * Those with a higher tolerance for alcohol may notfeel these effects as quickly as an average drinker. Tolerance often fools you into thinking you are more in control than you really are.

contents.label: Zero
contents.long-desc: No BAC means not being hungover, having fun with your friends, and celebrating your 21st safely!
You will feel relaxed and more outgoing at this level. Staying in this range means having fun without negative outcomes the next day.
Your judgement starts to get a little fuzzy. You probably think you are more in control than you really are. You are having fun and feeling happy with a BAC of around 0.08.
Perceptions of events are altered and reaction times are slower. You start to realize that drinking more did not boost your relaxation and fun.
Expect blurred vision, loss of balance, and feeling nauseous. Good feelings start to disappear, leaving you feeling anxious and restless.
Looking and acting like a sloppy drunk. Staggering and slurred words alert your friends that you have had too much.

You will have a hard time knowing where you are and what is going on. Blackouts (where you are aware but have diminishing functioning and won't remember anything tomorrow) happend around 0.20 for the average drinker.
In a haze and possibly unconscious. Alcohol poisoning is likely for lower tolerance drinkers.

contents.label: .40 and Above
contents.short-desc: Highest risk of alcohol poisoning and death
contents.long-desc: Decreased breathing and heart rate. Highest risk for alcohol poisoning and potentially death.
